entry.title: KO88 doesn't settle down payment to ASSET UNDER CONSTRUCTION
entry.content:
When executing KO88, SAP does not consider the down payment. Instead, it settles the full PO invoice amount to the asset, without deducting the down payment as expected.

I have already verified in OKO7, and the down payment is correctly flagged there.

entry.title: OB52 restrict changes after certain days
entry.content:
Let me start by saying I don't think this is possible but thought I would ask the community.  The business wants to stop a user from being able open prior periods.  

For example: It is Aug 2025 which is period 5 2026 in SAP, can we have a lock that prevents saving a change to open period 4 2026 after the 15th business day of the month?

entry.title: リース資産の昨年度遡及計上・リース情報変更に関して
entry.content:
2024年度開始のリース資産について、登録が漏れていた。
2025年4月になってそのリース資産の登録を行なった。
そのため、2024年度分の計上されるべき金額が計上されていない。
したがって、遡及計上を行ないたい。

リース期間：2024/12/01~2025/11/30
リース料：MYR 27,238.58
AFABを2025/4まで実施している

上記に加え、リース料が減額となり、リース期間も延長となることが分かった。

リース期間：2025/07/01~2026/11/30
リース料：MYR 27,184.73

この場合、どういった処理を行なえばよろしいでしょうか。
不足している情報がありましたらご連絡ください。

==============

I missed registering a leased asset for fiscal year 2024.
I registered the leased asset in April 2025.
As a result, the amount that should have been recorded for fiscal year 2024 was not recorded.
Therefore, I would like to record it retroactively.

Lease Period: December 1, 2024 - November 30, 2025
Lease Fee: MYR 27,238.58
AFAB is in effect until April 2025.

In addition to the above, I have learned that the lease fee will be reduced and the lease term will be extended.

Lease Period: July 1, 2025 - November 30, 2026
Lease Fee: MYR 27,184.73

What should I do in this case?
Please let me know if there is any missing information.

entry.title: Issue with Purchase Price Variance Posting in SAP ByDesign
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are experiencing an issue in SAP Business ByDesign related to product valuation during the procurement process.

Here’s the scenario:

  • In the product master data, under Valuation, we maintain a cost price of 1 Naira.
  • When creating a Purchase Order, we may buy the product at a different price (for example, 1,000 Naira per unit).
  • After posting the Goods Receipt, we noticed that the system splits the posting as follows:
    • Debit Material: 1.00 NGN
    • Credit Goods not yet Invoiced: 1000.00 NGN
    • Debit Difference in purchasing: 999.00 NGN

Our expectation is that the entire 1,000 Naira should be debited to the Material (inventory) account, not split between product valuation and purchase price difference.

Question:
How can we configure or treat this so that the full purchase price is capitalized in inventory, instead of posting most of it to the “purchase price difference” account?

Any guidance on the correct setup or configuration would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Depreciation showing successfull in AS02, but did not post!
entry.content:
Depreciation showing successfull in AS02, but did not post!

We did 2 changes on 2 assets which led to a newcalculation of the dep.run. When I wanted to run the depr. run, the changed assets were not within the run.

Now the changed assets have the mark "successfull depr. run", but they have not been depreciated (there is no accounting document!).

As we have to do Year-End-Close today, we have to have a sollution asap :-)....

Thanks and br,

entry.title: S4 brownfield migration, having ABST2 differences in 2nd & 3rd currency
entry.content:
Hello All,

We are in S4 migration process & executed ABST2 in our source ECC system, balances between FI-AA matching in first local currency, but there are huge differences in second & third currency.

Is it fine if we migrate with this differences or is it going to have any negative impact post migration, if we need to correct what is the way for same - It seems these differences accumulated over the years in ECC.

Please guide on this, any help will be greatly appreciated.

Regards,

Sumesh Gupta

entry.title: Payment Block not working in FB60 even though Manual payments block is checked
entry.content:
We have a payment block of X, and manual payments + change in pmnt prop. are checked

On the vendor master the payment block is set to "X"

But when we use FB60 we get a warning that the account has a payment block yet we can still post it and no payment blocks show.  I thought the manual payments block check would stop this, am I wrong?

entry.title: Hard currency values as realtime posting in asset depreciation area - Turkey POC
entry.content:
Dear sir/madam,

We have added hard currency as parallel currency for ledger postings

Local currency/Company code currency- USD

Global currency - USD

Hard Currency - TRY

we have created new chart of depreciation and created multiple depreciation areas for different ledger postings.

0L - Leading ledger

L1- Local ledger

T1- Tax ledger

For L1 ledger for asset postings, we want to have hard currency values as real time posting

So for ledger L1, we need system to take Hard currency valuess to be posted to GL instead of deriving from company code currency. is there any affect to other ledgers if we make hard currency values as real time posting. Please let us know.

 

Thanks

entry.title: Vendor Master Customization(Implementation).
entry.content:
Hi All,

I got a requirement from Business user, They want when End user fill data manually in BP to make Vendor Code, Normal when we save they provide me Vendor Code. But their requirement is User when save SAP not provide them Vendor Code , Only allow to save the DATA. After the finance approval only after approval or When Finance approve it by Approval Button only then they get the Vendor Code automatically on the End user Mail id.

My idea  is, We can make Custom T-CODE with the help of ABAP just like BP, And custom tables to store data.

I want to know the feasibility, Idea and solution for the requirement.

Please help me here.
